org.diirt.vtype

Interface Time

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    VBoolean, VBooleanArray, VByte, VByteArray, VDouble, VDoubleArray, VEnum, VEnumArray, VFloat, VFloatArray, VInt, VIntArray, VLong, VLongArray, VMultiDouble, VMultiEnum, VMultiInt, VMultiString, VNumber, VNumberArray, VShort, VShortArray, VStatistics, VString, VStringArray
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlarmTimeDisplayExtractor, AlarmTimeExtractor, PVFieldNTHistogramToVIntArray, PVFieldNTHistogramToVLongArray, PVFieldNTHistogramToVShortArray, PVFieldNTMatrixToVDoubleArray, PVFieldToVBoolean, PVFieldToVBooleanArray, PVFieldToVByte, PVFieldToVByteArray, PVFieldToVDouble, PVFieldToVDoubleArray, PVFieldToVEnum, PVFieldToVFloat, PVFieldToVFloatArray, PVFieldToVInt, PVFieldToVIntArray, PVFieldToVLong, PVFieldToVLongArray, PVFieldToVShort, PVFieldToVShortArray, PVFieldToVStatistics, PVFieldToVString, PVFieldToVStringArray

    public interface Time
    Time information.
    Author:
    carcassi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Timestamp getTimestamp()
      The timestamp of the value, typically indicating when it was generated.
      Integer getTimeUserTag()
      Returns a user defined tag, that can be used to store extra time information, such as beam shot.
      boolean isTimeValid()
      Returns a data source specific flag to indicate whether the time information should be trusted.

    • Method Detail

      • getTimestamp

        Timestamp getTimestamp()
        The timestamp of the value, typically indicating when it was generated. If never connected, it returns the time when it was last determined that no connection was made.
        Returns:
        the timestamp

      • getTimeUserTag

        Integer getTimeUserTag()
        Returns a user defined tag, that can be used to store extra time information, such as beam shot.
        Returns:
        the user tag

      • isTimeValid

        boolean isTimeValid()
        Returns a data source specific flag to indicate whether the time information should be trusted. Typical cases are when records were not processes and the timestamp has a zero time.
        Returns:
        true if the time information is valid
